@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“bonzakid, post:26, topic:265084”]Well its not working for me :S
its all weird now :S[/quote]

It could be based upon whether you’re using a boolean, integer, or any other data type. ‘muted == true’ may not be the data type your source uses, as it may use the int ‘muted == 1’.

	if (command.startsWith("yell") && muted == true) {

item.title: Uhh
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“bonzakid, post:10, topic:265084”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=349975.msg2689546#msg2689546 date=1235876947]

if (command.startsWith(“yell”) && command.length() > 5) {
String text = command.substring(5);
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + ": "
+ Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0))
+ text.substring(1) + “”;
} else if (muted == 1) {
sendMessage(“You’ve been muted for a reason.”);
}

I want to allow it so that people that are muted can not mute…

Try this.

if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && muted == false) {
                String text = command.substring(5);
                PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + ": "
                        + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0))
                        + text.substring(1) + "";
            } else {
                sendMessage("You've been muted for a reason.");
            }

[/quote]
ehh my ::yell command is not working and I don’t know why :S[/quote]

Ok i redid it and do this.

	if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5) {
                if(!muted) {
                sendMessage("You are muted and cannot yell!");
                } else {
		PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+ " - " +command.substring(5);
	}

Read full topic

item.title: Uhh
item.dc:creator: @bonzakid bonzakid
item.description:
@bonzakid wrote:

[quote=“jc22493, post:11, topic:265084”][quote author=jc22493 link=topic=349975.msg2689545#msg2689545 date=1235876928]
Just use an operator.

if(command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && !muted) { String text = command.substring(5); PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + ": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1) + "";
[/quote]
Try mine.[/quote]
nope neither are working.
Although i probably know why, I have another code that is simple to this.

if (command.startsWith("say") && (playerRights > 0)) { if (!muted) { String text = command.substring(4); String[] bad = { "chalreq", "duelreq", "tradereq" }; for (String element : bad) { if (text.indexOf(element) >= 0) { return; } } lastMessage[0] = lastMessage[1]; lastMessage[1] = lastMessage[2]; lastMessage[2] = Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1); if (lastMessage[0].equals(lastMessage[1]) && lastMessage[1].equals(lastMessage[2])) sendMessage(playerName + ": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); else yell(playerName + " [Staff]: " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); } else sendMessage(playerName + ": " + command.substring(5)); }
Thats my say code for admins. Is their a way that i could fix the mute and add it so if player rights = > 0 it becomes [Staff] like it is now but make an exception if rights = < 1 its just normal e.g Bonzakid:
but if staff e.g Bonzakid [Staff]:

Read full topic

String text = command.substring(5);
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + ": "
+ Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0))
+ text.substring(1) + “”;
} else if (muted == 1) {
sendMessage(“You’ve been muted for a reason.”);
}

I want to allow it so that people that are muted can not mute…

if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && muted == false) { String text = command.substring(5); PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + ": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1) + ""; } else { sendMessage("You've been muted for a reason."); } [/quote]
